meanings.definition: To spring or fly back, as in consequence of force of impact or the force of the discharge, as a firearm.
meanings.sent1: The ball recoiled off the wall with a loud thud.
meanings.sent2: She recoiled in surprise when the balloon popped.
meanings.sent3: The cat recoiled in shock when the toy mouse suddenly moved.
meanings.sent4: His words recoiled in her mind, leaving a lasting impact.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the accident recoiled in his thoughts, causing him to shudder.

meanings.definition: To draw back; start or shrink back, as in alarm, horror, or disgust.
meanings.sent1: He recoiled at the sight of the creepy crawly bug.
meanings.sent2: The child recoiled from the loud noise of the firework.
meanings.sent3: She recoiled in mock horror at the idea of eating broccoli.
meanings.sent4: The idea of failure recoiled in his mind, making him hesitate.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news recoiled in her heart, causing a sudden fear.

meanings.definition: To rebound or spring back from impact.
meanings.sent1: The rubber ball recoiled off the ground and hit the ceiling.
meanings.sent2: The basketball recoiled off the rim and back into play.
meanings.sent3: The joke recoiled off the audience, leaving them unamused.
meanings.sent4: His actions recoiled off his reputation, tarnishing it.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the bell recoiled off the walls, echoing through the room.
